alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains; Far Northwest Highlands; Jemez Mountains; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Northwest Highlands; Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood; South Central Mountains; Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Southwest Mountains; Tusas Mountains Including Chama; Upper Rio Grande Valley; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 6:04AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...SNOWFALL TODAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT MAY CREATE SLICK TRAVEL OVER WESTERN AND CENTRAL MOUNTAINS ABOVE 7500 FT... Several upper level weather disturbances will continue to move over or near New Mexico this week. These weather disturbances will produce rounds of light snowfall over high terrain areas of western and central New Mexico, including the Chuska, Tusas, Jemez, Sangre de Cristo, Sandia and Manzano and Sacramento mountains as well as the peaks of the Gila, tonight through Tuesday night. Motorists should exercise caution, be prepared for rapidly changing visibilities and slick roadways. Allow extra time to reach your destination. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit nmroads.com.
